Castlebrae Glebe is a partnership between Bield Housing Association and the City of Edinburgh Council to house older single people or couples, aged 50 years or above, along with providing flexible housing support, a meals service and personal care.  All flats and communal areas are built to ‘housing with varying needs’ standard.   Applicants must be:
- aged 50 years and above, and
- may have a physical disbility, and/or
- may have mild to moderate dementia, and/or
- are inappropriately placed in hospital or residential care, and/or
- have been assessed as requiring over 12 hours of housing support per week,

- level one care is required and there is a likelihood of inappropriate admission 
  to residential care
